etymologies: mid 19th century: from modern Latin Plesiosaurus, from Greek plēsios ‘near’ + sauros ‘lizard’

definitions: a large extinct marine reptile of the Mesozoic era, with a broad flat body, large paddle-like limbs, and typically a long flexible neck and small head.

notes.text: Infraorder Plesiosauria, superorder Sauropterygia: several families, including Plesiosauridae

shortDefinitions: large fossil marine reptile of Mesozoic era
